column3:
rental;;;;Online Real Estate ;Thu Nov 21 18:28:24 UTC 2013;

Redfin is an online real estate company that provides real estate search and brokerage services. Redfin uses an interesting combination of online real estate search and access to live agents. They employ their agents so they can better control customer satisfaction; traditional brokerage firms license their name to independent agents. Redfin claims to save homebuyers on average $7
column4: 500 by reimbursing roughly 1/2 of the buy-side real estate fee directly on closing. Redfin also pays bonuses to agents when they receive high customer satisfaction.

column1: Redfin’s main competitors include real estate search services like Trulia
column3: Estately and Realtor.com. None of their competitors combine online real estate search and brokerage services.

column2: Redfin combines MLS listing information with historical data into a single map. You can search for homes by neighborhood
column4: or you can refine results using detailed parameters like price and number of beds or baths. As of July 2007
column5: users can look for homes in Chicago
column8: including Central Maryland and Northern Virginia
column14: the Inland Empire and San Diego.

column1: The company was founded by David Eraker and is based out of Seattle; there is also a San Francisco engineering office
column2:
and local agents in each of the markets Redfin serves.
